pr_title: Enable setting of the server side encryption algorithm in StorageUploadFileOptions

timeline.message: Enable setting of the server side encryption algorithm in StorageUploadFileOptions
Enable setting of the server side encryption algorithm in StorageUploadFileOptions
Set server side encryption via enum

timeline.bodyText:
Is this too AWS specific to be in core module?
At Amplify layer, the categories should not adhere too much to a specific AWS service, and such details should be specified at the plugin layer. Exposing AES256 and KMS as supported encryption methods at a category level doesn't seem ideal to me, although I guess one can still argue that these are generic enough encryptions to be applicable to storage?
timeline.author: raphkim
timeline.diffHunk:

+package com.amplifyframework.storage;
+
+/**
+ * Represents storage server side encryption method type.
+ */
+public enum StorageServerSideEncryption {
+    /**
+     * AES256 encryption.
+     */
+    MANAGED_KEYS("AES256"),
+
+    /**
+     * aws:kms encryption.
+     */
+    KMS_KEYS("aws:kms"),

replies.bodyText:
Well, this is used across multiple modules, so I did not find a better place to put it.
Also, on the AWSMobileClient only these encryption methods are specified. I think this is a pretty required feature.
replies.author: edgar-zigis

replies.bodyText:
I believe the ideal place for StorageServerSideEncryption enum to be housed in is inside aws-storage-s3 module. However, the way that StorageOptions is structured makes it difficult to pass in plugin-specific options parameter to the category. This may require some refactoring from our side.
Meanwhile, this PR looks pretty solid otherwise. As you mentioned, the enum in question cannot be placed outside of core as it currently stands, so I think we will do a quick refactor of StorageOptions after merging in your changes.  How does that sound to you?
replies.author: raphkim
